channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ethiopia: Thousands of Tigray rebels killed, military claims
item.description: A leading general says 5,600 rebels have been killed in fierce fighting aided by airstrikes.

item.title: Kenyan men join battle to end FGM
item.description: Campaigners say it is important that Kenyan men join the battle to end female genital mutilation.

item.title: Sahel jihadists: West Africa faces up to policing its terror triangle
item.description: New tactics are being used in the fight against jihadists as Chad and France reduce their military roles.

item.title: The ATMs that dispense green fuel
item.description: How a start-up in Kenya is changing the way people cook.

item.title: Afrobasket: Tunisia to defend title against Ivory Coast in final
item.description: Tunisia will defend their Afrobasket title in Sunday's final against Ivory Coast after both sides won on Saturday.

item.title: World Cup: Cameroon profit as Ivorians held in Mozambique
item.description: Cameroon edge ahead of Ivory Coast in Group D after beating Malawi in Friday's World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Namibia's Mboma wins star-studded Diamond League sprint
item.description: Christine Mboma produces a powerful late surge to edge out Shericka Jackson in a star-studded women's 200m race at the Brussels Diamond League.

item.title: Jay Prayzah: 'Mbira is part of Zimbabwean culture'
item.description: Zimbabwean musician Jay Prayzah maintains his passion for traditional music despite being an Afrobeats star.

item.title: Toxic leak from Angola diamond mine kills 12 in DR Congo
item.description: The leak turned a tributary of the River Congo red and also killed many fish, a minister says.

item.title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
item.description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

item.title: Ethiopia's economy battered by Tigray war
item.description: Food prices are rising, the currency's value is falling and investor confidence is shaken.

item.title: Agnes Sithole: The woman who fought South Africa's sexist marriage laws
item.description: Agnes Sithole became an unlikely hero after her husband of nearly 50 years tried to sell their home.

item.title: Sierra Leone's chimpanzees: The newlyweds who set up a sanctuary
item.description: A couple who 30 years ago bought an abused chimpanzee are now trying to save a subspecies.

item.title: Kenya's Deputy President Ruto campaigns for 'Hustler Nation'
item.description: Deputy President William Ruto is portraying himself as the champion of the poor ahead of elections.

item.title: Paralympian Ntando Mahlangu: ‘My blades helped me learn to fly’
item.description: How Ntando Mahlangu's prosthetic blades changed his life and led him to two golds at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Paracycling: 'How handcycling helped me rebuild my life'
item.description: Macoumba Toure Sarr has been using handcycling to rebuild his life following a devastating accident.

item.title: Zambian President Hichilema: Corruption at 'horrifying' levels
item.description: Corruption is at "horrifying" levels, Hakainde Hichilema tells the BBC, a week after being sworn in.

item.title: Strictly: Why are South African dancers so popular?
item.description: As Strictly prepares to return to our screens next month another South African dancer has joined the professionals.

item.title: Kenya: How orphaned elephants' need for milk is empowering Samburu women
item.description: Kenya's Samburu women say selling goats' milk to an elephant sanctuary gives them independence.

item.title: Tortoise eating bird caught on camera by conservationist
item.description: It is believed to be the first time this behaviour of giant tortoises has been documented.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics 2020: Kgothatso Montjane, South Africa's wheelchair tennis hope
item.description: South Africa's wheelchair tennis star Kgothatso Montjane is aiming for a medal at the Tokyo Paralympics.
